translation: Who dote on wives lose mighty gain That lust, dynamic men disdain
explanation: Those who lust after their wives will not attain the excellence of virtue; and it is just this that is not desired by those who are bent on acquiring wealth
mk: கடமையுடன் கூடிய செயல்புரியக் கிளம்பியவர்கள் இல்லற சுகத்தைப் பெரிதெனக் கருதினால் சிறப்பான புகழைப் பெற மாட்டார்கள்
mv: மனைவியை விரும்பி அவள் சொன்னபடி நடப்பவர், சிறந்த பயனை அடையமாட்டார், கடமையைச் செய்தலை விரும்புகின்றவர் வேண்டாத பொருளும் அதுவே.
sp: மனைவியை விரும்பி அவள் சொல்லையே கேட்டு வாழ்பவர் சிறந்த அறப்பயனை அடையமாட்டார், செயல் ஆற்ற விரும்புவார் விரும்பாத இன்பம் அது.

This Kural, verse 901, discusses the impact of excessive desire and the importance of maintaining a balanced relationship with one's spouse. It argues that those who are overly indulgent in their attraction towards their wives will not reach the heights of virtue. This is because their focus is diverted from their duties and responsibilities, which are the stepping stones to achieving virtue.

The verse further emphasizes that this overindulgence is undesirable for those who are committed to their deeds and actions with an aim to accumulate wealth. In this context, wealth does not just refer to material gain, but also the richness of character, knowledge, and virtue. This is because being excessively focused on personal desires can distract one from their goals and responsibilities, leading to an imbalance in life.

In essence, this verse promotes the idea of balance and focus in life. It urges individuals to not get swayed by excessive desires, but to maintain a balanced approach towards personal relationships and duties, as that will lead to virtue and true wealth. 

The verse is a reflection of the teachings of the Thirukkural that promote self-control, harmony in relationships, and the pursuit of righteousness and virtue. It emphasizes that the path to prosperity and virtue lies in maintaining a balanced and disciplined life.
